titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

did.repository: The Historical Society of Pennsylvania 1300 Locust Street Philadelphia, PA 19107

bioghist.p: Joseph Zazyczny was born in Philadelphia and educated in Philadelphia and Colorado. He has held several positions in state and local government. He has been active in many Philadelphia-area Polish-American political and social groups, and was a founder and president of the Polish Heritage Society of Philadelphia.

scopecontent.p: This collection includes publications, correspondence, and other papers concerning the Polish-American community in Philadelphia, particularly in the 1970s and 1980s. Some files contain older documents (1930s). Included are files pertaining to the Bicentennial celebrations of 1976, the American Council of Polish Cultural Clubs, the folk dance festival, the Pulaski highway, and the Tadusz Kosciuzko statue.
